metadata.title: CVE-2020-25695 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in PostgreSQL versions before 13.1, before 12.5, before11.10, before 10.15, before 9.6.20 and before 9.5.24. An attacker havingpermission to create non-temporary objects in at least one schema canexecute arbitrary SQL functions under the identity of a superuser. Thehighest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality andintegrity as well as system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25695` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libecpg6 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpq5 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-10 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-client-10 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plperl-10 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython-10 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-10 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-10 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: postgresql-10 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
